parameters.definition: Units of paint required to make a large art piece
Units of glitter required to make a large art piece
Units of glue required to make a large art piece
Units of paint required to make a small art piece
Units of glitter required to make a small art piece
Units of glue required to make a small art piece
Minimum number of large art pieces to be made
Minimum number of small art pieces to be made

description: An art store makes large and small art pieces. The store has available \param{PaintAvailable} units of paint, \param{GlitterAvailable} units of glitter, and \param{GlueAvailable} units of glue. To make a large art piece requires \param{PaintLarge} units of paint, \param{GlitterLarge} units of glitter, and \param{GlueLarge} units of glue. To make a small art piece requires \param{PaintSmall} units of paint, \param{GlitterSmall} units of glitter, and \param{GlueSmall} units of glue. The store must make at least \param{MinLarge} units of each large and small art pieces. If the profit per large art piece is $\param{ProfitLarge} and the profit per small art piece is $\param{ProfitSmall}, how many of each should be made to maximize profit?
